questions: What is the complexity of Go target modes?
What is Big-O for streaming vs generator mode?

answer.text:
## Go Target Mode Complexity

### Streaming Mode

| Operation | Time | Space |
|-----------|------|-------|
| Simple transform | O(n) | O(1) |
| Regex matching | O(n × m) | O(1) |
| JSON parsing | O(n) | O(d) |

### Generator Mode (Fixpoint)

| Operation | Time | Space |
|-----------|------|-------|
| Fixpoint iteration | O(n × k) | O(n) |
| Indexed join | O(1) lookup | O(n) |
| Unindexed join | O(n²) | O(n) |
| Aggregation | O(n) | O(g) |

Where: n = facts, k = iterations, g = groups, d = nesting depth

questions: What is the complexity of recursive compilation?
How does BFS transitive closure scale?
What is the complexity of memoized recursion?

answer.text:
## Recursion Pattern Complexity

| Pattern | Time | Space | Generated Code |
|---------|------|-------|----------------|
| BFS transitive closure | O(V + E) | O(V) | Queue + visited set |
| Tail recursion | O(n) | O(1) | Iterative for-loop |
| Linear (memoized) | O(n) | O(n) | Map-based cache |
| Mutual recursion | O(n) | O(n) | Shared memo map |

### BFS Implementation

```go
visited := make(map[string]bool)  // O(V) space
queue := []string{start}          // O(V) max size
```

### Memoization

```go
var memo = make(map[int]int)  // O(n) space
if result, ok := memo[n]; ok { return result }  // O(1) lookup
```

questions: What is the complexity of BoltDB queries?
How do key strategies affect performance?
When is full scan vs direct lookup used?

answer.text:
## Database Query Complexity

### Key Strategy Performance

| Strategy | Lookup | Range Scan | Full Scan |
|----------|--------|------------|----------|
| Single field key | O(log n) | N/A | O(n) |
| Composite key | O(log n) | O(k log n) | O(n) |
| Hash key | O(log n) | N/A | O(n) |

### Query Optimization

| Query Pattern | Strategy | Complexity |
|---------------|----------|------------|
| `key = value` | Direct lookup | O(log n) |
| `key_prefix = value` | Prefix scan | O(k log n) |
| `field > value` (non-key) | Full scan | O(n) |

**Tip:** Put frequently queried fields in the key for O(log n) lookups.
